alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 14 at 1:54AM MDT until June 14 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: .Heavy rainfall on top of a deep and melting snowpack over the past several days could lead to excessive runoff into creeks and streams emanating from the mountains. This excessive runoff into waterways could quickly push water levels to outside their banks. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and ongoing snowmelt runoff is possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following area, Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain below 5000 feet through Tuesday could cause rivers and creeks to go above flood stage. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
